edu.umn.biomedicus.tokenization

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umn.biomedicus.tokenization.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends Object
    Performs tokenization on text according to penn-treebank-like word tokenization rules. Doesn't split trailing periods. Splits units like 10cm. Splits dimensions like 10x14.

    "Performs tokenization of text according to penn - treebank - like word tokenization rules. Does n't split trailing periods. Splits units like 10 cm. Splits dimensions like 10 x 14."

    Usage:

       
   String text = "An example sentence.";
   for (TokenResult result : Tokenizer.tokenize(text)) {
     CharSequence tokenText = result.text(text);
   }

    If you want to use a different list of units than the one built in, you can supply a file path using the system property "biomedicus.tokenizer.unitsListPath". Otherwise, you can put a file "unitsList.txt" on the "edu.umn.biomedicus.tokenization" classpath.

    Instances of this class are stateful do not support parallel processing. If you plan on using the stateful instance methods advance(char, int) and finish() use multiple instances of this class to support parallelism, otherwise use the stateless static class methods allTokens(CharSequence) and tokenize(CharSequence).

    If using advance(char, int) and finish() the instance is reusable.

    Implementation details: advances one character at a time until it encounters a word separator —i.e. a whitespace character like a space, tab, or newline—then uses a set of regex-based rules to split words into multiple tokens.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tokenizer()
      Default constructor, uses the built-in global state units list.
      Tokenizer(List<String> units)
      Creates a tokenizer which splits an alternate list of units from the ends of numbers.
      Tokenizer(List<String> additionalUnits, List<String> ignoredUnits)
      Creates a tokenizer which will split additional or less units from the ends of numbers.

      Advances the tokenizer by one token, returning any tokens finalized in a list.

      Tokenizes the text, returning a new list of all the tokens in the string.

      Finalizes the tokenizer, returning any tokens from the last word (if there is one) in the state.

      Replaces the default list of units with a new list of units.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer()
        Default constructor, uses the built-in global state units list.

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer(List<String> units)
        Creates a tokenizer which splits an alternate list of units from the ends of numbers.
        Parameters:
        units - the units to split off the end of numbers.

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer(List<String> additionalUnits,
                 List<String> ignoredUnits)
        Creates a tokenizer which will split additional or less units from the ends of numbers.
        Parameters:
        additionalUnits - any additional units to split
        ignoredUnits - any units not to split

    • Method Detail

      • allTokens

        @Nonnull
public static List<TokenResult> allTokens(@Nonnull
                                                   CharSequence text)
        Tokenizes the text, returning a new list of all the tokens in the string. Don't change the text during tokenization, this method doesn't make a protective copy.
        Parameters:
        text - a CharSequence to tokenize
        Returns:
        List containing all of the tokens in the text

      • tokenize

        @Nonnull
public static Iterable<TokenResult> tokenize(@Nonnull
                                                      CharSequence text)
        Returns an iterable that creates an iterator that lazily tokenizes the text, returning the tokens in the text one-by-one. Don't change the text during tokenization, this method doesn't make a protective copy.
        Parameters:
        text - a CharSequence to tokenize
        Returns:
        iterable that tokenizes during iteration.

      • addUnit

        public static void addUnit(String unit)
        Adds a unit to the default list of units to break off the end of words. This method affects the global state of this class, all instances that have been created using the default Tokenizer() constructor and all future instances creating any constructors, use with caution.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit

      • removeUnit

        public static void removeUnit(String unit)
        Removes a unit from the default list of units to break off the end of words. This method affects the global state of this class, all instances that have been created using the default Tokenizer() constructor and all future instances creating any constructors, use with caution.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit

      • replaceUnits

        public static void replaceUnits(List<String> newUnits)
        Replaces the default list of units with a new list of units. This method affects the global state of this class, all instances that have been created using the default Tokenizer() constructor and all future instances creating any constructors, use with caution. This method is also not thread-safe, there is a possibility that any currently working instances may check a (temporarily) empty units list.
        Parameters:
        newUnits - the new list of units

      • advance

        @Nonnull
public List<TokenResult> advance(char ch,
                                          int index)
        Advances the tokenizer by one token, returning any tokens finalized in a list.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to advance
        index - the index of the character
        Returns:
        list of any tokens created from a single "word" (text between word breaks)

      • finish

        @Nonnull
public List<TokenResult> finish()
        Finalizes the tokenizer, returning any tokens from the last word (if there is one) in the state.
        Returns:
        list of any last tokens
